thread.title: Morning links: Jimmer Fredette fighting for spot in San Antonio; ESPN ranks Kyle Whittingham's best wins
thread.title_full: Morning links: Jimmer Fredette fighting for spot in San Antonio; ESPN ranks Kyle Whittingham's best wins | Deseret News

author: Ryan McDonald
title: Morning links: Jimmer Fredette fighting for spot in San Antonio; ESPN ranks Kyle Whittingham's best wins
text:
Former BYU Cougar guard begins training camp with Spurs; Was Oregon victory Whittingham's most impressive?; Jazz forward slams media personality on Twitter.
More Coverage Jazz coach Quin Snyder 'more relaxed' in second season Burks back from shoulder surgery, ready for upcoming Jazz season Media day âï¸ Ready for the season! #gospursgo
A photo posted by Jimmer Fredette (@jimmerfredette_32) on Sep 28, 2015 at 2:03pm PDT
Former BYU basketball star Jimmer Fredette's NBA career is hanging by a thread as he begins training camp with the San Antonio Spurs, and a report from Jeff McDonald of the San Antonio Express-News on Tuesday indicated that the guard is in a fight for the final spot on the roster.
In a story about how Spurs head coach Gregg Popovich will have to play "mad scientist" because of the many new faces on his team, news about Fredette is brief but telling.
"NBA veterans Jimmer Fredette and Rasual Butler remain in the mix for the final roster spot," McDonald writes.
On Monday, NBA reporter Adrian Wojnarowski of Yahoo! tweeted that Butler has been making a strong early impression in San Antonio.
Was Ducks win Kyle Whittingham's best?
Ever since the University of Utah football team beat Oregon on Saturday, a debate has continued about whether that victory was the Utes ' best win of the Kyle Whittingham era.
ESPN's David Lombardi took a stab at answering that question Tuesday, as he ranked what he thinks are Whittingham's most impressive victories.
The result? Saturday's win came in at No. 2 on Lombardi's list, after Utah's victory over Alabama in the 2009 Sugar Bowl.
"This sheer margin of this past Saturday's victory earned it consideration for the top spot, but we ultimately couldn't justify ranking a September game over the Sugar Bowl," Lombardi wrote.
Gordon Hayward disses Colin Cowherd
The Utah Jazz started training camp Tuesday with two practices, but forward Gordon Hayward found time during the evening to publicly criticize media personality Colin Cowherd.
On Monday, Cowherd spoke out against the increasing popularity of eSports, which is multiplayer video game competitions. It wasn't the first time Cowherd had done so.
An avid gamer, Hayward took issue with Cowherd's criticism with this tweet .
Mark Sandritter of SB Nation picked up on Hayward's tweet and added this commentary :
"In League of Legends terms, that was a Faker level burn (don't know who that is? Check out our World Championships beginners guide )," Sandritter wrote. "Did Hayward know that photo existed and just saved it for the perfect moment? Or did he dive deep into a Google search only to come away with that? Either way, that's one heck of a find."
Ryan McDonald is a sports reporter at DeseretNews.com . Follow him on Twitter @ryanwmcdonald.
